description: Mort is a Realtor relationship radar that detects timely reasons to reach out to contacts and generates copy-ready, human-sounding messages based on real-world events and personal interests.

userStories.title: Normalize and store contact interests for radar matching
userStories.description: As Mort, I need structured, searchable interests derived from user-entered notes so I can match contacts to real-world events.
acceptanceCriteria: Contacts support an array of normalized radar interests (strings or tags).
Freeform notes can be summarized or parsed into radar interests without losing original text.
No interests are inferred without explicit user-provided context.
Typecheck passes
Lint passes
userStories.notes: Do not over-normalize. Simple keyword-style interests are sufficient.

userStories.title: Search external news and events relevant to contact interests
userStories.description: As Mort, I want to search current news and events related to a contact’s interests so I can detect timely outreach opportunities.
acceptanceCriteria: System can query external sources (via OpenAI or tool calls) using interest + location context.
Search results are recent and include a short explanation of relevance.
Results are deterministic for the same inputs (temperature low or zero).
Failures degrade gracefully without blocking the UI.
Typecheck passes
Lint passes
userStories.notes: Do not scrape directly. Use API-based search only.

userStories.title: Score and filter outreach opportunities
userStories.description: As Mort, I need to decide whether an event is strong enough to justify reaching out now.
acceptanceCriteria: Each opportunity includes a numeric score and human-readable reasons.
Opportunities are filtered if cadence, suppression, or do-not-contact rules apply.
The same contact is not repeatedly suggested for the same event.
Typecheck passes
Lint passes

userStories.title: Generate copy-ready text message suggestions
userStories.description: As a Realtor, I want short, natural text messages I can copy and send without editing.
acceptanceCriteria: Each opportunity generates 2–5 message variants.
Messages are under 320 characters and sound human.
Messages clearly reference the triggering event.
No emojis, no sales language, no calls to action.
Typecheck passes
Lint passes
userStories.notes: This is not marketing copy. Err casual and personal.

userStories.title: Expose 'Run Now' opportunities in the UI
userStories.description: As a Realtor, I want to see who I should reach out to right now and why.
acceptanceCriteria: UI displays contact name, score, reasons, and message variants.
User can copy a message and mark the contact as contacted.
Marking contacted updates suppression and cadence state.
Typecheck passes
Lint passes
Manual browser verification completed
userStories.notes: Do not auto-refresh or auto-trigger outreach.

userStories.title: Persist radar state to prevent repeated prompts
userStories.description: As Mort, I need memory of what I’ve already suggested so I don’t nag the user.
acceptanceCriteria: Radar state tracks events/angles already used per contact.
Previously used angles are excluded from future suggestions.
Suppression windows are respected.
Typecheck passes
Lint passes
userStories.notes: This memory must be explicit and inspectable.
